item.title: Emoticons in commit messages for manuscripts
item.description: I recently wrote a note about using emoticons in a standard way in commit messages and I now use them in a standard way following Gitmoji. item.title: Emoticons in commit messages
item.description: When you are working on a project with GitHub (or a similar web service based on ) that has tens of commits, using emoticons in commit messages makes the search in the history of your project very efficient. To add one emoticon to your commit message, you must use its name (check this cheat sheet) within colons in the commit message, e.g. “add this :emoticon_name:”.
